poem:
**Haunted Wallets**

In the pumpkin-glow of October eve,  
spiders spin webs of rising cost,  
while candy creeps up the shelves.  
  
A wallet shivers, its paper bones  
rattling with the ghostly whisper  
of vanished coins.  

Parents, huddle close—  
find solace in bulk-bought  
Haribo and clever treaties,  
so the sting of sweets' inflation  
haunts not your door.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "All the money-saving tricks to make sure you won’t frighten your wallet at Halloween Save on sweets Sweet prices have gone up as the cost of ingredients and production have risen. To keep your Halloween outlay low, bulk-buy and check packets.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
